arts.ttl: Post-Match Reaction: Serhou Guirassy and Pascal Groß Lead Demolition Party Against Union Berlin
arts.sum: Union’s wheels started coming off in the second half, and the combined weight of Guirassy, Adeyemi, Groß, Beier, Reyna, and then Chukwuemeka became too much. I’ve noticed growing impatience among our readers throughout the season with various BVB players, including Serhou Guirassy and Pascal Groß.

arts.ttl: Niko Kovac after first Bundesliga win: ‘We got the lucky own-goal today.’
arts.sum: BVB trainer Niko Kovac - while praising his team - also took care to emphasize the role of luck when speaking on Saturday night's victory.

arts.ttl: MOTM Poll: Guirassy & Groß Dominant as BVB Knock Union Berlin for Six
arts.sum: Serhou Guirassy headed home a lovely Pascal Groß cross to double Dortmund’s lead just before the break, and with Union posing very little threat, Dortmund looked happy to control the game without overextending themselves. BVB dominated from the opening whistle and opened the scoring 25 minutes into the game when Union Berlin’s Diogo Leite deflected a Julian Ryerson cross beyond his own goalkeeper.

arts.ttl: Guirassy scores 4 goals for Dortmund, first to do so since Haaland in 2020
arts.sum: Serhou Guirassy became the first player since Erling Haaland to score four goals for Borussia Dortmund in a 6-0 rout of Union Berlin on Saturday in the Bundesliga. Guirassy had only scored nine in 19 league games prior to Union’s visit, far from reaching the 28 goals he scored in 28 Bundesliga appearances for Stuttgart last season.
BVB’s coach Niko Kovac praised Serhou Guirassy and Pascal Groß following their impactful performances in a big win over Union Berlin.

arts.ttl: PLAYER RATINGS | Borussia Dortmund 6-0 Union Berlin
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund thrashed Union Berlin 6-0 to secure Niko Kovac’s first Bundesliga win as Dortmund head coach. For the first time in a very long time, Dortmund actually looked like…

arts.ttl: Borussia Dortmund and Serhou Guirassy combine to bamboozle Union Berlin
arts.sum: With his four unanswered goals, Serhou Guirassy was the star of a Borussia Dortmund show that left visiting Union Berlin stunned as Niko Kovač celebrated a maiden Bundesliga triumph at the BVB helm. Serhou Guirassy heads home past Frederik Rønnow for Dortmund's second goal just before half-time - IMAGO/Dennis Ewert/RHR-FOTO

arts.ttl: Groß-Guirassy connection set BVB back on track
arts.sum: BVB scored half a dozen goals at home against Union Berlin. Serhou Guirassy scored four, while Pascal Groß provided four assists.

arts.ttl: Match Thread: BVB Host Union Berlin
arts.sum: Use those and don’t share any illegal streams in the comments. Absolutely no illegal streams.

arts.ttl: “Please go and vote!”: Dortmund Head Coach, Kovac pleads to German public ahead of Sunday’s federal election
arts.sum: On Saturday evening, Borussia Dortmund host Union Berlin in the Bundesliga, but Head Coach, Niko Kovac states that what happens on Sunday is more important as Germany head to the…
